intro: Neoporteria centeteria, commonly known as the slender milkweed, is a flowering plant native to parts of South America. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and opposite, ovate leaves that are typically covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, clustered flowers with five petals, often in shades of pink or purple. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in open woodlands or along stream banks. Neoporteria centeteria is a member of the Apocynaceae family, which includes many species with milky sap.
